text: The school buildings in use as a restaurant in 2018 York College for Girls was a girls' school in York, England, founded in 1908 and closed in 1997. The school was founded by the Church Schools Company (later the United Church Schools Trust) and opened with 12 pupils on 24 January 1908 in Low Petergate, York. By 1997 it had about 200 pupils and was in the same buildings with later extensions. It closed in 1997 "after a prolonged battle with staff, parents and pupils to keep the school in existence". There had been reports of a "cash crisis" the previous year. The buildings are grade II* listed, and after the school closed they were occupied by a restaurant called ("the old school" in Italian). ==Former pupils== Notable former pupils include: *Dame Janet Baker (born 1933), singer *Margaret Mann Phillips (1906-1987), historian *Mary Isolen Fergusson (1914-1997), civil engineer ==References== ==External links== * ==Further reading== * Category:Girls' schools in North Yorkshire Category:Defunct girls' schools in the United Kingdom Category:1908 establishments in England Category:Educational institutions established in 1908 Category:1997 disestablishments in England Category:Educational institutions disestablished in 1997 Category:Grade II* listed buildings in York Category:Grade II* listed schools
